d0ZguMEhbJARDhHImggOPQ.text: This is my go-to coffee & food spot. Some of the only simple & reliable food I was able to find in Edinburgh for everyday food, like avocado toast & soup.  Good coffee! Great ambiance! A place where you can really sit and read.

J-0dQ_32QRVeO8o50wXLUQ.text: This is a well needed addition to Edinburgh's growing coffee scene. Thomas J. Walls fills an important gap in providing a large comfortable venue with plenty of seating and most importantly, great coffee with a choice of good brunch and food options. Highly recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of Thomas J Walls - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Thomas J Walls - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Thomas J Walls - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

mMVlSoEbjbYOOQ_Bf9flRw.text: There's a lot to like about Thomas J Walls; a coffee shop taking over an old opticians.  It's a pretty distinct venue, especially from the outside, and it's big so there is a decent chance of getting a seat even if it's busy.   I came here for brunch and wasn't disappointed. It's a bit different from the usual including some decent looking potato rosti dishes. I went for the sriracha benny; which I thoroughly enjoyed. Because really who doesn't love sriracha. Or eggs benedict. They have a good selection of healthy tasting juices which are a nice breakfast option. I will definitely be back here again.   They take coffee seriously - and they have decent beans from Square Mile. I have had some really good flat whites here - and some less so. When you have BrewLab round the corner you've got to be at the top of your game coffee-wise. They have only been open a couple months so hopefully things will become consistent.   Come here for brunch or for when you want a big space to sit with your laptop and drink some coffee and juice.

photos.caption: Photo of Thomas J Walls - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Sriracha Benny

6In0S3z5KczndDHQUvxq8g.text: Beautiful old opticians turned coffee shop, stylish and very open inside with lovely wooden and brickwork walls, lovely space to sit in.  Really yummy coffee and menu looks great, excited to try more of it!

photos.caption: Photo of Thomas J Walls - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Soya latte
Photo of Thomas J Walls - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Masala Chai
Photo of Thomas J Walls - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

8pIs1NPPUTT0l8y_p0bw1Q.text: I had a really quality sandwich: bacon, Brie, dig jam, and spinach and it came on this fresh soft chewy special loaf that mixed together so well, it wasn't overly filling but worked with the long black coffee (an americano with less water)  and was just the right amount for breakfast. This place was really close to my hotel so I'm surprised I didn't notice it as I walked past it sooner!  This place is definitely worth a stop if you are traveling here!

wgf02KIHdd0MIrui4eF-0Q.text: I got avocado on toast, cappuccino, and a glass of juice. The poached egg was a bit over cooked and the cappuccino a bit thin, but other than that it was great. Good sizes, good food, lovely atmosphere, a good place when you want a cup of coffee and quick lunch without any fuzz. Will definitely come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Thomas J Walls - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. The avo on toast, yum.
